content: drawers for a PDU-based IBM z16 configuration options is listed in Table 8-4. Options for a BPA-based IBM z16 are Table 8-5 on page 346. Both tables are based on no CPC drawer reserve options being configured. Table 8-4 PCIe+ I/O drawer limit for PDU-based IBM z16 systems Note: The maximum number of I/O drawers in the table is reduced by one for each CPC drawer reserve feature that is present. Number of frames Max39 Max82 Max125 Max168/Max200 1 3 2 1 - 2 6 7 6 4 3 - 12 11 9 4 - - - 12 346 IBM z16 (3931) Technical Guide Table 8-5 PCIe+ I/O drawer limit for BPA-based IBM z16 systems Depending on the number of I/O features, the configurator determines the number of PCIe+ I/O drawers that is required. To better use the MES for I/O capability, carefully plan the initial configuration to allow concurrent upgrades up to the target configuration.
